channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: On a vu la Lexus LFA qui troque le V10 contre un moteur électrique et on n’a qu’une envie : la conduire
item.description: Les choses se précisent (un peu) chez Lexus, qui confirme que son concept de coupé sportif sera bien 100 % électrique, mais sans donner de fiche technique. Mais rien n’empêche de spéculer sur les questions auxquelles la marque ne répond pas encore, notamment pour sa batterie, potentiellement à électrolyte solide. Et admirer de près son design vraiment spectaculaire lors de sa première mondiale au Japon, au pied du Mont Fuji ! ...

item.title: I'm a huge board games fan — here are the 7 best ones to help you survive January 2026
item.description: Here's 7 more games to help you survive January without always needing your tech.

item.title: Man City vs Chelsea Live Streams: How to Watch Premier League 2025-26 From Anywhere in the World
item.description: We'll show you how to watch Man City vs Chelsea as a mangerless Blues chase a crucial win at the Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Et si la vie était apparue sur Mars avant la Terre ? La chronologie qui dérange
item.description: Comment la vie a-t-elle commencé sur Terre ? Si les scientifiques ont des théories, ils ne comprennent pas encore pleinement les étapes chimiques précises qui ont mené à la biologie, ni quand les premières formes de vie primitives sont apparues. Et si la vie sur Terre n’avait pas son origine...

item.title: Il aspire, démêle, lave, ce Dyson V12s Detect Submarine perd plus de 200 € pour nettoyer vos intérieurs
item.description: Le Dyson V12s Detect Submarine propose une bonne puissance d'aspiration et permet non seulement d'aspirer mais aussi de laver. Son prix passe de 719 euros à 499 euros chez Boulanger

item.title: The wild, intense rise and fall of Flappy Bird
item.description: Flappy Bird was almost preposterously simple. If you ever played the game, even once, you surely remember how it worked, but here's a summary just in case. You were a bird. Your job was to fly, left to right, for as long as possible without crashing into the green Mario-ish pipes coming from both the […]

item.title: Xreal’s Neo is the best-looking mobile dock for AR glasses
item.description: When the Nintendo Switch 2 launched in June, AR glasses brand Viture beat Xreal to the punch with its own multi-port battery pack that doubles as a portable video dock for the new console. After several months, Xreal answered with the Neo, a 10,000mAh (38.7Wh) battery pack with DisplayPort Alt video-out. It sure is one […]

item.title: Narwal’s Flow 2 robovac might help you find that earring you lost
item.description: Narwal's successor to its edge-mopping Flow robovac is here, and it sports a refreshed design along with a new cleaning mode that can scan your floor to tag valuables that you may have dropped, like jewelry, your phone, a key, wallet, and more. When the Flow 2 detects one of these items, the robovac will […]

item.title: Baseus’ new desktop dock includes a Qi2 25W charger
item.description: Chinese accessory brand Baseus has launched a new desktop dock for CES 2026 with an exhaustive array of ports and power options, including a magnetic Qi2 25W charging pad that flips up from the dock's top. Baseus calls the Spacemate RD1 Pro a 15-in-1 docking station, though there might be some double counting to get […]

item.title: Xreal’s entry-level AR glasses get a spec bump and 3D conversion
item.description: At CES 2026, Xreal announced an upgraded, slightly more affordable version of its entry-level AR glasses: the $449 Xreal 1S. And this time, you can also convert 2D videos to 3D without any extra apps, software, or proprietary players. At a glance, the Xreal 1S don't look much different from the Xreal One or One […]

item.title: This startup brought WALL-E to life and will also sell you WALL-E’s weird cousin
item.description: An AI robotics startup called Zeroth is turning WALL-E into a real-life robot companion. Though the WALL-E version with the Disney-licensed design is currently only on sale in China, Zeroth is launching what looks like an off-brand version of the beloved bot in the US for $5,599. The bot, called the W1, doesn't feature WALL-E's […]

item.title: The 33 most exciting new movies of 2026: TechRadar's top picks that are coming to the big screen, Netflix, and more
item.description: 2026 looks like it's going to be another great year of new movies – here are our top choices for the weeks and months to come.

item.title: The Xreal 1S glasses put a big virtual screen in front of your face, and I'm loving the simplicity and pure entertainment value
Xreal updates its entry-level personal cinema glasses at CES
item.description: If you’ve been on the fence about trying the sort of “AR glasses” that, until recently, were called “personal cinemas,” then check this out. Xreal has turned up to CES 2026 with an updated version of its entry level Xreal One glasses, first launched at the end of 2024. The new model, dubbed the 1S (yes, with a numeral rather than the word) gets marginally better specs and $50 knocked from the asking price. If you’re unfamiliar, One is a wearable spatial display that connects over USB-C to any compatible device including smartphones, tablets, laptops and consoles. It has two teeny-tiny displays...
